elements.name: an agent can introduce a new agent to the network by 'befriending' it
elements.description: The only way for the OfferNet to grow in a decentralized manner (i.e. without central controlling repository) is for new agents to get introduced to the network via old agent's recommendation.

steps.name: Agent "AgentOne" is created on the OfferNet
Agent "AgentTwo" does not exist on the OfferNet
Agent "AgentOne" befriends Agent "AgentTwo"
Agent "AgentTwo" exists on the OfferNet
there is "knows" link between "AgentOne" and "AgentTwo"
there is no "knows" link between "AgentTwo" and "AgentOne"

elements.name: an agent can 'befriend' another agent existing in the network
elements.description: OfferNet is a social network of Agents. Each agent has an ability to initiate creation of 'knows' link to another agent existing in the network. So if two unconnected agents exist on the network and one of them knows the identity of the other, then the first one can initiate creation of 'knows' link to another in the underlying graph which should result in the appropriate relation between them. Note that the 'knows' relation is not reciprocal.

steps.name: Agent "AgentOne" is created on the OfferNet
Agent "AgentTwo" is created on the OfferNet
there is no "knows" link between "AgentOne" and "AgentTwo"
there is no "knows" link between "AgentTwo" and "AgentOne"
Agent "AgentOne" befriends Agent "AgentTwo"
there is "knows" link between "AgentOne" and "AgentTwo"
there is no "knows" link between "AgentTwo" and "AgentOne"

elements.name: an agent can post an {offer-demand} pair to the OfferNet
elements.description: Agents in an Offer Network engage in exchange by publishing an offer-demand pairs, or 'work's. See explanation of the Offer Network structure in [Data structures and objects].

steps.name: Agent "AgentOne" is created on the OfferNet
Agent "AgentOne" posts a pair of offer "offer-1" and demand of "demand-1"
Agent "AgentOne" owns a work which "demands" item "demand-1"
Agent "AgentOne" owns a work which "offers" item "offer-1"

elements.name: an agent can access all posted offers and demands by traversing its social network
elements.description: In a distributed system where there is no global observer which has the registry of all agents and their items of offer and demand. In this case, the only way for an agent to access items of other agents is to traverse its social network (to a given depth) and ask all friends of friends to send information about their items. Since the OfferNet is fully connected (and hopefully is a small world network) the whole network can be scanned this way, depending on availability of time and resource constrains of an agent which initiates the search. The expected number of items that an agent has to find in its social network is calculated as follows: $(numberOfAgents -1) * pairsPerAgent * 2$ (as every pair holds two items: one demand and one offer..).

steps.name: there exists an sequentially connected line of '4' agents
all agents have posted '1' offer-demand pair each
first agent initiates search of '3' depth
agent finds '6' demands and offers in its social network

elements.name: an agent can access all posted offers and demands by traversing its social network
elements.description: In a distributed system where there is no global observer which has the registry of all agents and their items of offer and demand. In this case, the only way for an agent to access items of other agents is to traverse its social network (to a given depth) and ask all friends of friends to send information about their items. Since the OfferNet is fully connected (and hopefully is a small world network) the whole network can be scanned this way, depending on availability of time and resource constrains of an agent which initiates the search. The expected number of items that an agent has to find in its social network is calculated as follows: $(numberOfAgents -1) * pairsPerAgent * 2$ (as every pair holds two items: one demand and one offer..).

steps.name: there exists an sequentially connected line of '20' agents
all agents have posted '2' offer-demand pair each
first agent initiates search of '19' depth
agent finds '76' demands and offers in its social network

name: Agent behaviour
description: Agents can interact with the graph structure of OfferNet by issuing semantically constrained graph traversals which query or mutate the graph as needed. These define the API of the OfferNet graph.

name: OfferNet processes
description:
The structure of OfferNet is realized as a Property Graph where agents / offers and demands connect via edges and all is enriched with properties. Agents interact with the graph (query/mutate) by executing  semantically constrained graph traversal processes. The result of these processes depend on the context of operation, but we want to make sure that they are deterministic when the context is known and clearly defined. These processes can be centralized or decentralized.
